column4: well... my issue is that my HDA Audio hasn't started since few last boots... how could I re-enable it?
what version of ubuntu are you using ?
I'm using Kubuntu Karmic
and you have a problem with what exactly ?
and now it doesn't work ?
but, today morning the sound just didn't load... pulseaudio plays the system bell, but the main sound Inte HDA Realtek ALC660-VD doesn't work at all
I hardly suppose the problem could be treated differently
HDA is out from HDMI
I don't think it will work on your speakers if they are not plugged HDMI
I am using centrino1duo asus laptop, the HDA was responsible for all sound
I'd try another option then the HDA
try internal audio
explain me, please
well I use gnome so it is fairly different that's why you need people using KDE to help, BUT on gnome, I go to sound preferences, I choose Hardware and I choose which one to use
I have an internal Audio and an HDMI one
with inputs and outputs
what shall I also do now?
right click on the sound button, go to preferences
yes ?
see !
you were right, it's a kde issue, but I can't fix it yet :(
it might be the same problem with KDE, change the driver you are using on KDE into another one
